newsitem.title: USA: NOTICE OF SALE - North Plainfield, N.J..
newsitem.headline: NOTICE OF SALE - North Plainfield, N.J..

text.p: SEALED PROPOSALS will be received by the Borough Council of the Borough of North Plainfield, in the County of Somerset, New Jersey (the
Building, 263 Somerset Street, North Plainfield, New Jersey 07060 on

at 8:00 o'clock p.m. Prevailing Time at which time they will be publicly opened and announced, for the purchase of the Borough's $3,575,000 General Improvement Bonds, $400,000 Sewer Utility Bonds and $50,000 Assessment Bonds
payable on June 15 in each year as follows:
$170,000 in each of the years 1998 to 2001,
$220,000 in each of the years 2002 to 2007,
$250,000 in each of the years 2008 to 2010,
$275,000 in each of the years 2011 to 2013,
$25,000 in each of the years 1998 to 2013,
$5,000 in each of the years 1998 to 2007, inclusive.
$200,000 in each of the years 1998 to 2001,
$250,000 in each of the years 2002 to 2007,
$275,000 in each of the years 2008 to 2010,
$300,000 in each of the years 2011 to 2013,

The Bonds shall be issued in registered form by means of a book-entry system with no physical distribution of bond certificates made to the public. One bond certificate for each maturity will be issued to The Depository Trust Company, New York, New York (DTC'') and immobilized in its

custody. The book-entry system will evidence ownershi the Bonds in the principal amount of $1,000 or any multiple thereof, with transfers of ownership effected on the records of DTC and its participants pursuant to rules and procedures established by DTCand its participants. The Bonds are subject to redemption prior to maturity at the option of the Borough in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale to be made available to interested persons (the Notice of Sale''). This Summary Notice of Sale is intended only as a brief summary of the Notice of Sale, which Notice of Sale is hereby incorporated herein by this reference thereto. The Notice of Sale and Proposal for Bonds should be reviewed by potential bidders for additional terms and conditions of the sale of the Bonds prior to bidding on the Bonds. The Bonds will bear interest from their date at a rate or rates of interest in multiples of 1/8th or 1/20th of 1% per annum specified by the successful bidder payable on each June 15 and December 15, commencing June 15, 1998, in each year until maturity. Each proposal must be for all the bonds offered. The purchase price specified must not be less than $4,025,000 nor more than $4,026,000. Bidders must at the time of making their bids deposit a certified, cashier's or treasurer's check in the amount of $80,500 drawn upon a bank or trust company to the order of the Borough. The Bonds will be sold to the bidder specifying the lowest net interest cost in accordance with the terms set forth in the Notice of Sale. The Borough will furnish the Bonds and the approving legal opinion of LeBoeuf, Lamb, Greene & MacRae, L.L.P., Newark, New Jersey, Bond Counsel. The Bonds will be designated as

obligations'' for purposes of Section 265(b) (3) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended. Copies of the Preliminary Official Statement, the Notice of Sale and the Proposal for Bonds are available by contacting the undersigned Borough Clerk at the Municipal Building, 263 Somerset Street, North Plainfield, New Jersey 07060 (telephone (908) 769-2900). By order of the Borough Council of the Borough of North Plainfield.
